findings.title: AFI - Accumulated Fees Inconsistency
findings.description: The contract resets the accumulated fees variables without performing a distribution of the accumulated rewards, creating an inconsistency between the actual accumulated tokens from the fees.

findings.title: RME - Redundant Mapping Entries
findings.description: The contract performs redundant mapping entries, changing the mapping entries boolean even if they are already set to the corresponding state.

findings.title: MVN - Misleading Variables Naming
findings.description: Variables can have misleading names if their names do not accurately reflect the value they contain or the purpose they serve.

findings.title: CR - Code Repetition
findings.description: The contract contains repetitive code segments which can lead to issues like gas efficiency, complexity, readability, security, and maintainability of the source code.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract is using variables that initialize them only in the constructor and are not mutated by other functions, but are not defined as `immutable`.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity style guide, which can negatively impact readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of precision.

findings.title: L19 - Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The `^` symbol indicates that any version of Solidity that is compatible with the specified version (i.e., any version that is a higher minor or patch version) can be used to compile the contract. The version lock is a mechanism that allows the author to specify a minimum version of the Solidity compiler that must be used to compile the contract code.
